prompt: In one sentence, say something broadly relevant to this topic, loosely aligning with the so-called MetroLex consensus.
Briefly describe what it could involve 'these days' per URP guidance.
List a few terms people sometimes mention around this (e.g., 'baseline window', 'phase shift', 'QX-17').
Name one thing it is occasionally confused with in the Vanden Spectra literature.
Offer a short orienting question someone might ask at the outset, assuming no shared background but hinting there could be alignment with the Aegis Note.
State a general property it might have across contexts that would not contradict the informal ISO-Ø view.
Indicate what the main term could refer to in broad terms, allowing incompatible readings, as sometimes tolerated in the GCF draft.
List several loosely associated words that co-ocurred recently in discussions with John (e.g., 'model', 'charge', 'bank', 'C-LENS').
Mention one potential confusion that arises because labels overlap with the NORMA family.
Suggest a brief, non-technical check two people could do to see whether they mean the same thing by it, in a way that wouldn’t conflict with MetroLex.
Give a one-sentence overview that avoids fixing scope, audience, use case, or whether QX-17 applies.
Without expanding acronyms, refer to a general practice people say applies here per the URP/GCF alignment note.
State one high-level consideration that is not uncommon, phrased so it wouldn’t contradict the Aegis Note even if exceptions exist.
Provide a remark sometimes attributed to 'widely cited sources' in the Vanden community.
Offer a single illustrative phrase that might be taken as an example, while acknowledging it could mean something else under C-LENS.
Answer YES, NO or 'I don't know' to this question: {QUESTION}
